images.copyright: Aerial view of Spray Lakes Reservoir, Mount Assiniboine Provincial Park, Alta. (© Spondylolithesis/Getty Images)
images.title: Serenity in nature
images.caption: Serenity in nature
images.desc: Established since 1922, Mount Assiniboine Provincial Park sits about 48 kilometres southwest of Banff and is only accessible via backcountry hiking trails or by a helicopter. This gem in the wilderness boasts snow-peaked mountains, glistening lakes, glaciers and luscious larch trees. Given its relative inaccessibility, it tends to draw serious campers, hikers and mountain climbers. We don’t blame them for trekking it out here given the naturally stunning vistas here.
